io.dvlopt.linux.epoll

Class Epoll

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.dvlopt.linux.epoll.Epoll
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    AutoCloseable

    public class Epoll
extends Object
implements AutoCloseable
    Class representing an epoll instance.

    Quite close to the native API but wrapped in a java idiomatic interface.

    See Also:
    Epoll man pages

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Epoll()
      Creates an epoll instance and allocates the needed resources.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Epoll

        public Epoll()
      throws IOException
        Creates an epoll instance and allocates the needed resources.
        Throws:
        IOException - When one of these conditions occured :
        • Per-user limit on the number of epoll instances or per-process limit on the number of file descriptor has been reached.
        • System-wide limit on the number of file descriptors has been reached.
        • An unplanned error occured on the native side.

    • Method Detail

      • close

        public void close()
           throws IOException
        Closes this epoll instance and releases the allocated resources.
        Specified by:
        close in interface AutoCloseable
        Throws:
        IOException - When an unplanned error occured on the native side.

      • getEpollFD

        public int getEpollFD()
        Retrieves the file descriptor of this epoll instance.

        An epoll file descriptor can itself be monitored by another instance.

        Returns:
        The file descriptor of this epoll instance.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - When this instance has been closed.

      • add

        public Epoll add(int fd,
                 EpollEvent event)
          throws IOException
        Starts monitoring a file descriptor for relevant events.

        A file descriptor can be added only once.

        Parameters:
        fd - File descriptor.
        event - Describing what events should be monitored.
        Returns:
        This instance.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - When the given file descriptor is invalid, has already been added, or is the file descriptor of this epoll instance.
        IllegalStateException - When this epoll instance has been closed.
        IOException - When one of these conditions occured :
        • Limit of maximum user epoll watches has been reached.
        • Kernal had unsufficient memory for this operation.
        • An unplanned error occured on the native side.
        UnsupportedOperationException - When the given file descriptor does not support epoll.

      • modify

        public Epoll modify(int fd,
                    EpollEvent event)
             throws IOException
        Modifies how a file descriptor is monitored.
        Parameters:
        fd - File descriptor.
        event - Describing what events should be monitored.
        Returns:
        This instance.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - When the given file descriptor was invalid.
        IllegalStateException - When this epoll instance has been closed or the given file descriptor has not been added.
        IOException - When the kernel had unsufficient memory for this operation or another unplanned error occured on the native side.

      • remove

        public Epoll remove(int fd)
             throws IOException
        Stops monitoring a previously added file descriptor.
        Parameters:
        fd - File descriptor.
        Returns:
        This Epoll instance.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - When the given file descriptor was invalid.
        IllegalStateException - When this epoll instance has been closed or the given file descriptor has not been added.
        IOException - When the kernel had unsufficient memory for this operation or another unplanned error occured on the native side.

      • wait

        public void wait(EpollEvent event)
          throws IOException
        Waits for an event to happen.
        Parameters:
        event - Will be overwritten by the kernel in order to describe what happened and give back the previously registered arbitrary long value.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - When this epoll instance has been closed.
        IOException - When an unplanned errors occured on the native side.
        See Also:
        wait( EpollEvent, int )

      • wait

        public boolean wait(EpollEvent event,
                    int timeout)
             throws IOException
        Waits for an event to happen within the given timeout.
        Parameters:
        event - Will be overwritten by the kernel in order to describe what happened and give back the previously registered arbitrary long value.
        timeout - How many milliseconds at least should we wait. A timeout of -1 will block forever until something happens.
        Returns:
        True if an event occured within the given timeout.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - When this epoll instance has been closed.
        IOException - When an unplanned errors occured on the native side.

      • wait

        public int wait(EpollEvents events)
         throws IOException
        Waits for events to happen (at most the size of events).
        Parameters:
        events - Will be overwritten by the kernel in order to describe what happened and give back the previously registered arbitrary long value for each file descriptor involved.
        Returns:
        How many events occured. This function unblocks as soon as something happens but sometimes, several events can happen virtually at once.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - When this epoll instance has been closed.
        IOException - When an unplanned errors occured on the native side.
        See Also:
        wait( EpollEvents, int )

      • wait

        public int wait(EpollEvents events,
                int timeout)
         throws IOException
        Waits for events to happen (at most the size of events) within the given timeout.

        The given EpollEvents will be filled by the kernel to describe the type of event that occured and write back the user data.

        Parameters:
        events - Will be overwritten by the kernel in order to describe what happened and give back the previously registered arbitrary long value for each file descriptor involved.
        timeout - How many milliseconds at least should we wait. A timeout of -1 will block forever until something happens.
        Returns:
        How many events occured before the timeout elapsed. This function unblocks as soon as something happens but sometimes, several events can happen virtually at once.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - When this epoll instance has been closed.
        IOException - When an unplanned errors occured on the native side.
